topic.title: Web Author VPAT Accessibility Conformance Report

section.title: International Edition
section.p:
VPAT® Version 2.3 – December 2018
Product Name/Version
Product Description is an innovative web-based authoring tool. Its powerful technology and adaptive interface allows you to review, contribute, and edit content from anywhere you have access to a browser.
Date 25 March 2019
Contact Information support@oxygenxml.com
Notes has been designed and enhanced to adhere to the U.S. Government Section 508 accessibility standards and the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG). For details, see
Evaluation Methods Used:
The following applications were used for testing :
Desktop browsers: Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, and Internet Explorer
Assistive technologies: NVDA, VoiceOver, JAWS, Microsoft Narrator

section.title: Applicable Standards/Guidelines
section.p: This report covers the degree of conformance for the following accessibility standards/guidelines:

row.entry:
Level A - Yes
Level AA - Yes
Level AAA - No

Level A - Yes
Level AA - Yes
Level AAA - No

p.xref: Revised Section 508 standards published January 18, 2017 and corrected January 22, 2018

entry.xref: EN 301 549 Accessibility requirements suitable for public procurement of ICT products and services in Europe - V2.1.2 (2018-08)

section.title: Terms
section.p: The terms used in the Conformance Level information are defined as follows:

ul.li: Supports: The functionality of the product has at least one method that meets the criterion without known defects or meets with equivalent facilitation.
Partially Supports: Some functionality of the product does not meet the criterion.
Does Not Support: The majority of product functionality does not meet the criterion.
Not Applicable: The criterion is not relevant to the product.
Not Evaluated: The product has not been evaluated against the criterion. This can be used only in WCAG 2.0 Level AAA.

section.title: WCAG 2.x Report
section.p: Tables 1 and 2 also document conformance with:
Revised Section 508: Chapter 5 – 501.1 Scope, 504.2 Content Creation or Editing, and Chapter 6 – 602.3 Electronic Support Documentation.

p.note: When reporting on conformance with the WCAG 2.x Success Criteria, they are scoped for full pages, complete processes, and accessibility-supported ways of using technology as documented in theWCAG 2.0 Conformance Requirements.

row.entry:
provides text alternatives for non-text items with some exceptions:
Some images do not have a text alternative.
Some decorative images are not hidden from assistive technologies.
Authors are responsible for including alternative text to images when they include them in their documents or applications.
The product does not provide prerecorded audio-only or video-only content.
The product does not provide prerecorded media that requires captions.

entry.p: 1.2.3 Audio Description or Media Alternative (Prerecorded) (Level A)

row.entry: The product does not provide prerecorded media that requires audio description.

Most user interface elements provide programmatic information about structure and relationships, except:
Some variations in presentation in text, such as change tracking information is not conveyed to screen readers.
Some generated form control inputs are not labeled correctly
The product presents content in a meaningful sequence.
does not rely on sensory characteristics of components such as shape, size, visual location, orientation, or sound for instructions.
does not rely on color-alone to convey information.
does not include audio that plays automatically.

Most product functionality can be operated through a keyboard interface. Exceptions include:
The special character picker plugin grids do not receive keyboard focus

entry.p: The user cannot move out of the editor area using just the Tab or Shift+Tab shortcuts. It is however possible to leave the editor by switching to a different region using the documented keyboard command Ctrl+F6.

row.entry: does not have shortcuts mapped to only letter, punctuation, number or symbol characters.
The product does not include time limits.
does not include elements which move, blink, scroll or auto-update.

entry.p: 2.3.1 Three Flashes or Below Threshold (Level A)

row.entry: The product does not contain flashing content.

ul.li: 501 (Web)(Software) – Does not apply to non-web software
602.3 (Support Docs) – Does not apply to non-web docs

row.entry: contains skip links to bypass repetitive content. Landmark regions are also provided in order to facilitate navigation for assistive technologies.

has unique and descriptive page titles for all screens.
The titles of editor tabs contain the name of the file being edited.
Components receive focus in a meaningful order.
does not use multipoint or path-based gestures.
The down-event of the pointer is not used to execute functions in .
Most labels contain the text that is presented visually.
does not have any action that can be operated by device motion or user motion can also be operated.
identifies the default language on every page.
For the most part, context changes do not occur when controls receive focus as expected.
does not cause unexpected changes of context when interacting with elements.

Most errors and warnings are described to the user in text. Exceptions include:
Spell checking errors are not announced to the user immediately after writing. They are however announced when navigating through text.
Validation errors are not announced as they are detected, however they are accessible through the Validation panel.
The login dialog for some connectors does not include an error message in case of failed login.

Labels are provided for input fields. Exceptions:
Some select inputs in the Table Properties dialog are not labelled.
does not have accessibility parsing errors.
The product’s interface presents name, role and value information for controls.
The product does not provide live media that requires captions.
The product does not provide prerecorded video content that requires audio description.

is usable in both portrait and landscape display orientation, with exceptions:
The dashboard file browser has a very small height on small devices in landscape mode.
specifies input purposes for interface components.

has sufficient contrast between the foreground and background colors, with few exceptions, including:
Change tracking content in the document for some of the author colors.
Change tracking content in some review panel items, when the item is selected.
Placeholders shown in empty elements.
Comments marked as done.
Text can be resized up to 200 percent without loss of content or functionality.
does not contain images of text.

entry.p: In the editor, the text will reflow correctly and there is no scrolling in two dimensions required. Above 250% zoom the document becomes scrollable in two dimensions but the second dimension scroll is not required for operation - the text does not leave the visible area.
On the dashboard, the file browser becomes hard to use for zoom levels above 200%.
User interface components and states have sufficient contrast against adjacent colors.

row.entry: There is no loss of content or functionality in the editor when changing text spacing.

entry.p: 1.4.13 Content on Hover or Focus (Level AA 2.1 only)

ul.li: 501 (Web)(Software) – Does not apply to non-web software
602.3 (Support Docs) – Does not apply to non-web docs

row.entry: has multiple ways of locating screens in the application.

has a visible indication of focus throughout, with the following exceptions:
Dialogs have one tab navigation step on the dialog element and it is not visible.
The language of parts is not specified.

ul.li: 501 (Web)(Software) – Does not apply to non-web software
602.3 (Support Docs) – Does not apply to non-web docs
501 (Web)(Software) – Does not apply to non-web software
602.3 (Support Docs) – Does not apply to non-web docs

row.entry: The product does not present input scenarios where suggestions for error correction are known.
The product does not process legal commitments or financial transactions or modify user-controllable data.

Status messages regarding operation results and search progress are presented to the user by assistive technologies without receiving focus. There are some exceptions:
Some changes to the document structure, like element deleted/inserted or undo/redo actions are not announced by the screen reader.

entry.p: 1.4.7 Low or No Background Audio (Level AAA)
1.4.9 Images of Text (No Exception) Control (Level AAA)

row.entry: Much of the product is operable without vision; however. As noted in 1.3.1 Info and Relationships, some structural and hierarchical information is not communicated to screen reader users.
The product is operable with limited vision. However, as noted in 2.4.7 Focus Visible, there are some rare cases where some elements do not have a visual indicator of focus.
The product does not rely on color alone to convey information.
The product does not require hearing for use.
The product does not require hearing for use.
The product does not require speech for use.
The product is operable with limited manipulation.
The product does not require reach or strength for use.

entry.p: 302.9 With Limited Language, Cognitive, and Learning Abilities

row.entry: The product is operable by users with limited language, cognitive, and learning abilities. To accommodate users with limited cognition, the UI provides icons, text, or a combination of both for controls.

section.title: Chapter 4: Hardware
section.p: Notes: Not Applicable - is not a hardware product.

section.title: Chapter 5: Software
section.p: Notes: is a web application, not a software product. However, the web application includes authoring functionality, hence Chapter 5: Software 504 Authoring Tools applies to this product.

entry.p: The product is not platform software.

row.entry: The product does not disrupt platform features that are defined in the platform documentation as accessibility features.

entry.p: As noted in 1.3.1 Info and Relationships, some object information is not exposed programmatically.

row.entry: The insert table feature in the editing area of the product does not communicate information about the headers, however row and column information is presented in a way that can be used by assistive technology.
Values of controls are exposed programmatically to assistive technology.

entry.p: Values of controls can be set programmatically, including through assistive technology.
The structure of elements in the editor is communicated by the breadcrumbs view, but not all hierarchical relationships are accessible programmatically.

row.entry: Text can be set programmatically, including through assistive technology.
Actions that can be executed on an object can be determined programmatically from the context menu or content completion menu.

entry.p: Actions on objects can performed by users, including those using assistive technologies.

Most changes in states and other properties are communicated through notifications that are communicated to assistive technology. However, there are some exceptions related to panels and the editor area such as when new cells are added to a table.

row.entry: This product is not platform software.
The product does not function as an assistive technology.

p.b: 503.4 User Controls for Captions and Audio Description

row.entry: The product does not provide controls for volume adjustment.
The product does not provide controls for program selection.

entry.p: 504.2 Content Creation or Editing (if not authoring tool, enter “not applicable”)
504.2.1 Preservation of Information Provided for Accessibility in Format Conversion

row.entry: The product does not provide format conversion.
The product does not provide PDF export.
For DITA documents, there is an optional Schematron that performs accessibility checks on the content and prompts the authors whenever it detects errors.
The product does provide several templates. However, these templates offer only minimal structure and do not markup content in ways that promote following the WCAG success criteria.
The documentation for lists and explains the accessibility and compatibility features of the product.

entry.p: The self-service documentation is generated with Oxygen XML WebHelp. You can find its VPAT statement here.
602.4 Alternate Formats for Non-Electronic Support Documentation

row.entry: All necessary documentation for is provided electronically.

entry.p: 603.2 Information on Accessibility and Compatibility Features

row.entry: has a user manual section dedicated to accessibility.
Support services for support is provided over a variety of channels including email and phone.

section.title: Legal Disclaimer
section.p: This report describes Oxygen XML Web Author's ability to support the stated VPAT Standards/Guidelines, subject to Syncro Soft's interpretation of the same. This accessibility report is provided for informational purposes only, and the contents hereof are subject to change without notice. SYNCRO SOFT MAKES NO WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, IN THIS DOCUMENT. For more information regarding the accessibility status, please contact us at sales@oxygenxml.com.
